intro: Cryptangium triquetrum, commonly known as the three-cornered cryptangium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
